resources.string: Your custom background image could not be found; the default will be used instead.
A custom background image is not defined; the default will be used instead.
Sorry, your custom image is too large and has caused an out of memory error.

Welcome to BeeCount! The purpose of this app is to store count details for several projects and allow you to count each separately. Each project may have multiple 'counts', each being something such as a pattern repeat or a row which you wish to track. Use the buttons below to create new projects or manage existing ones.

 By editing a project after creating it you can also link counts together so that one increments another.

Settings can be changed by accessing the menu on this screen (menu button or 3-dot overflow menu above).

Should you have any questions you may visit the Ravelry group at http://www.ravelry.com/groups/beecount, or email bug reports to knirirr@gmail.com.
Please fill in the empty boxes!
You must define at least one count!
Each count name must be unique!

Select the value at which this count will reset itself automatically (set to 0 to turn off)
Select the value to which this count will reset itself automatically
Value to which count will reset
Select the alert message and the row at which it should be activated (set to 0 to turn off)

Some BeeCount installations are affected by a database bug. This can probably be fixed by deleting BeeCount and re-installing, but if you are willing to backup your beecount.db and e-mail it to knirirr@gmail.com before doing that it would be greatly appreciated as it will help me fix this. Apologies again for the nuisance.
Are you sure you want to delete this project?
Please check values and try again
Please check which counts you have linked
The increment value cannot be zero
The increment value can only contain numbers
Save failed; please check the count values.

To call up a menu, press and hold a count name. This will allow resetting a count, setting the value to which it will reset (default is 0), setting it to reset automatically, or setting a row alert. To link counts together, select the \'edit\' option from the menu or icons at the top of the screen and press the \'Link Counts\' button; further help options are available on the edit screen.\n\nIf you have any questions then please feel free to contact the author by email (knirirr@gmail.com).

This screen allows editing of a project, and also the linking together of accounts so that one increases ('increments') or resets the other.

When two counts are linked, this will be displayed as 'X increments Y every Z', meaning that if X starts counting from 0, then 1 will be added to Y when X reaches Z, 2Z, 3Z and so on. For example, if rows increment repeats every 5, then 1 repeat will be added on 5,10,15 rows and so on. Each time the increment is reached, a 'toast' notification will pop up. Links and counts may be both added and deleted on this screen.

For further assistance please contact the author by email (knirirr@gmail.com).
Choose default, custom or no background image.
Use the default fancy font (everywhere but here ;-).
Change the position of the + and - buttons.
Prevent screen from sleeping whilst counting.
Select the background image to be used when a custom image is selected.
Maximum value for spinners (e.g. for count auto-reset).
This stops the \"x has incremented y\" toasts from popping up during counting.
Set the value at which this count will reset itself. The count will be reset to 0 unless the reset level (see below) is also changed. Set to 0 to disable.
When %1$s resets it will reset to the number here. To cause it to reset the auto reset value (above) must be set to a value higher than 0.
You may change the value of %1$s from its current value of %2$d by editing it here.
Each count may have zero or more alerts which will be triggered when the count reaches that level. Use the add button to the right to add more and the close button on each alert to remove it.
Are you sure you\'d like to do this? The alert will be deleted immediately.
